body.script:
var siteAlerts = [{"id":3786,"title":"Yough All Call April 8, 2020","body":"
Good evening!\n
This is the Yough School District calling with a few reminders. Due to loss of days in March, we will be using our snow make up days as instructional days that will count towards student days. Therefore, Thursday, April 9, Monday, April 13, and Tuesday, April 14, originally scheduled as the spring holiday, are now considered school days. The off day will be Friday, April 10.\n
Secondly, lunches will be distributed tomorrow, Thursday, April 9 for parents signed up for the lunch program, and next week on Tuesday, April 14 and Friday, April 17. The change in dates will allow time for our cafeteria workers making the lunches to have time off over the holiday. Please make note of these changes.\n
We want to thank everyone for their time and dedication of making our online learning platform a huge success. To date, 90% of our students are logging in, working and continuing their education. Thank you again for being part of the Yough School District. On behalf of the district enjoy your holiday weekend and remember, stay calm, stay safe, and stay home….and always choose kind.","dateStart":"2020-03-20T15:02:51Z","baseGroupName":"Yough School District","hash":"Mb8hMQbdB9OGjulIpzmP9my/bGWk7Z+gQeBhb5WJxOg=","updateDate":"2020-04-08T19:31:50Z"}];

img.alt: Orange and Green Letter Y Yough Logo

p.strong: NOTICE OF BOARD MEETING OF THE YOUGH SCHOOL DISTRICT

div.p: Notice is hereby given that the Board of School Directors of the Yough School District will hold a Virtual Board Meeting on Tuesday, April 7, 2020 at 7:30 pm. The public is instructed to refer to the Yough School District website at www.youghsd.net, click the School Board tab for instructions on the process to make public comment and to view the recorded meeting. This advertisement serves as official notice that the Board of School Directors may take any action and vote on general business items.
There will only be ONE school board meeting in April, 2020. The workshop/voting meeting will be held on Tuesday, April 7, 2020 at 7:30 PM. There will be NO meeting held on Tuesday, April 14, 2020.

em.strong: Following agenda posting, public comment on board agenda items will be taken at the following email address up until 12:00 pm on Tuesday, April 7, 2020 for inclusion at the 7:30 pm meeting. The email for public comments is public@youghsd.net.

div.p: The district will begin providing online learning on Friday, April 3, 2020. The Google Website that will be utilized for this online learning and will be posted here starting that day. In the meantime, students and parents can prepare by knowing the student username, email and password for learning. Students all have a username and password within the Yough School District. Below is an example of the format of those usernames and passwords. Students will need to know their username, email and password.
Username Email Format: graduation year, last name, first initial @youghsd.net
i.e. 20sardonj@youghsd.net
Password Format: first name initial, last name initial, student ID number (same as lunch number)
Username Email Format: graduation year, last name, first initial @youghsd.net
i.e. 20sardonj@youghsd.net
Password Format: three random characters, student ID number (same as lunch number)
High School and middle school students should have their passwords. If they do not, they may contact their building principals to obtain that information.

ul.li: Data caps paused for 60 days, all plans temporarily unlimited
Internet Essentials (normally $9.95/mo) for low income households are now free for 60 days
Existing customers with data plans automatically moved to Unlimited SMartphone Data for 60 days (excluding roaming)
Data allowance extended to schools and students to provide 20GB of data/month for 60 days
Existing customers with metered data plans will be moved to unlimited plans for 60 days (expected ready on 3/20/2020)
Additionally, they will continue to offer internet access for qualifying limited income households at $10 a month through our Access from AT&T program.
AT&T Wifi is also free (not sure about timing for how long)
No reported special changes to network at this point
Waiving late fees, not terminating accounts
Wifi hotspots open for the next 60 days

div.aria-label: Sign up for Lunch during School Shutdown

h2.span: Sign up for Lunch during School Shutdown

div.p: Please fill out the form below if you are planning on picking up a lunch during the school shutdown period. There must be a form filled out for each school-age child in your family. Pick up days are Mondays and Fridays.
Pick up days are Mondays and Fridays from 11:00 AM to noon at the following locations:
If you are unable to fill out the form electronically, you can call the following phone number 724-446-7272, extension 1002 and leave the following information:
Child’s name
Parent/Guardian Name
Grade Level
Building
Phone number
Email address
Site Pick Up Location

p.span: The resources below should be utilized by students in Grades K-4 as a means of retention of information during times that school is not in session. If you need any help or assistance, please contact your child's building principal.

span.strong: Self-Respect – Valuing yourself and your abilities.
We ask that you also practice the previous PBIS words: PBIS Word of the Week

div.p: Science
STEAM
Virtual Field Trips
Online Read Alouds and Activities
From our Guidance Department:
Hello Elementary School Students and Families,

We hope that this letter finds all of you healthy and safe. We are missing all of you very much and look forward to seeing all of your smiling faces again very soon! Our department is working diligently on ways to provide support for our families during this difficult time. If your child has a counseling need or if you as a parent/caregiver have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact either of us. Together, we will find supportive ways to work with your child during these transitions. Our students and families are very important to us, and we are “walking with all of you.”

Moving forward, we will be providing virtual opportunities for your child to connect with both of us. The staple of our Elementary School Counseling program has always been offering student groups, teaching classroom lessons, and offering student lunch bunch opportunities. These opportunities will help support your child’s academic, social, and emotional development through these ever changing times. More information on how your child and family will be able to access these daily opportunities will be forthcoming from our office. Please keep an eye out, for these fun opportunities that will begin within the next week.
As school counselors we want to encourage you to:

These trying times can be stressful for everyone, including kids. They pick up on everything from adult conversations around them to the information they encounter on the media. Remember that panic only creates more panic.

Being a good listener is key. Help your children communicate their feelings and remind them it’s okay to feel sad, mad, afraid, or confused. It’s important to meet your children where they are and to answer their questions and to address their concerns.
Talking about the facts that we know helps to relieve anxiety.
Reassure your children they are safe. Doctors, scientists, and teachers across the county are working on this and doing everything possible to protect us and keep all of us safe.
Give your children instructions on how to stay safe and healthy. Review and model basic hygiene and healthy practices for protection.

Your children may be scared of the things they’ve heard or seen on television or social media. Monitor and limit social media and screen time to prevent your children from becoming over saturated with all of the messages. Do fun things, if possible!

Some family activities to do at home include: reading books, practice counting things, doing puzzles, building forts, going on walks, playing outside, painting, playing with toys and Legos. Whenever possible, children benefit from choices—give them choices daily.
Simply put, just spend time together!
Take care and stay healthy,
Mr. Dennis Gates Dr. Lisa M. Mumau
Elementary School Counselor Elementary School Counselor

p.span: The resources below should be utilized by students in Grades 5-8 as a means of retention of information during times that school is not in session. If you need any help or assistance, please contact your child's building principal.
Please click on the Google Link for almost 100 educational links by subject to enjoy with your student!

The resources below should be utilized by students in Grades 9-12 as a means of retention of information during times that school is not in session. If you need any help or assistance, please contact your child's building principal.
Click on “Courses” at the top left side of the page to access several subjects in math, science, social studies, English, humanities, engineering, computing, etc.

KINDNESS 101 - FREE ONLINE CLASS taught by CBS News Correspondent Steve Hartman. Steve posts each day via Facebook Live at 2:00 PM. Tune in live or access archived sessions at this link: KINDNESS 101 CLASS

div.p: Our friends at YIMS have put together a great resource page. Please click on the GOOGLE LINK for almost 100 educational links by subject to enjoy with your student!

There are free online lessons via YouTube and there is also updated information regarding AP Exams.
Career Readiness Activities to explore different jobs and build your career portfolio. Log into your PA CareerZone Account:
Keystone Exam Test Preparation - Students do not have to create an account to use the free content.

div.aria-label: Motivational Video of The Day: 5 minute exercise

h2.span: Motivational Video of The Day: 5 minute exercise

div.p: The Nutrition Group and Yough School District will be offering after school meals to school-age children in the Community. The program is free and open to all children 0-18 years of age. Meals are being served at Yough High School, Yough Intermediate Middle School, and a new site, HW Good Elementary! Please see the link below for more information and for the October menu.

a.title: After School Dinner Program Information and Menu.pdf

p.a: After School Dinner Program Information and Menu.pdf

img.alt: Orange and Green Letter Y Yough Logo

div.p: Middle School Home Ec.

Do you live in the Yough School District and have a child who will be 5 years old by September 1, 2019? Enrollment packets are available at your local elementary school from March 4 through May 13 during school hours 10 am – 3 pm. Please bring 2 proofs of residency, the birth certificate, and immunization records to pick up a packet during that period and make an appointment for the Annual Yough School District Kindergarten Registration and Screening Day:

p.strong: West Newton Elementary - Wednesday, May 15, 2019 - 724-872-5877, x6000
HW Good Elementary - Thursday, May 16, 2019 - 724-446-5503, x5000

div.p: The Final Adoption of 2019-2020 Budget is available to view on the Business Department page.
Please see below a letter that was sent home on Thursday, February 28, 2019 with all students in regards to monitoring social media use as well as the Internet.

div.h3: Yough Middle Selected for Nationwide Google Pilot Program

div.p: Below is a link to an article from the Pittsburgh Post Gazette regarding the fees being waived for volunteers working with children. The fees being waived are the Child Abuse and the Criminal Background check. The FBI Clearance is not included in this waiver, and it is still required for volunteering in the schools. If you already received your clearances, there is no reimbursement for the monies spent. The fee waiver will begin on July 25.

Act 34 - PA Criminal History Check
Act 151 - Child Abuse History Clearance
Act 114 - FBI Finger Print

div.h3: Title IX Gender Equality In Sports

div.p: The Yough School District will make public on the Yough Athletic Webpage the findings reported on the disclosure statement for Title IX gender equality in sports . Any questions can be directed to the Director of Athletics, Title IX Liaison or High School Principal.
Gold Passes are available in the high school office. Must be a district resident and 62 years of age or older. Report to the high school office with proof of ID to pick up and sign for the pass.

div.p: Please use the PDF File below to watch the Danger Zones Safety Video
With the recent events happening in and around our community it is important to share just how serious the consequences can be. Please see the link to the article below for more information.
